climbs.name: Yummy Noises
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Kelley Mayr, Bob Bolton, Steve Cox, Catherine Cox, Stan Roy, Janine Roy (10/2002)

content.protection: 5 bolts, anchors at top (shared with Don't Call Me Jesus), lower off or rap.
content.location: Right of Banana Hammock and just left of Don't Call Me Jesus where a white dike is.

content.description: The leftmost route on The Beach slab, starts just right of a right facing corner system.  Sustained smearing and edging. Sandbagged at 10b, more like 10d especially compared to other routes on the wall.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt rap anchor

climbs.name: White Shadow
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Steve Cox, Bob Bolton  8/2002

content.description: Next route right of Lizard King.  Really fun edging and smearing.  Probably a little soft for the grade, feels similar in difficulty to Lizard King 5.9.

climbs.name: Tree Line
climbs.fa: FA: Ben Chapman & Randy McClure (June 1988) via direct aid (A2). FFA: Troy Mayr, Steve Cox, Bob Bolton. Oct 2002.

content.description: Follow a very thin, beautiful crack up through smooth, polished granite. 25m/80' lower off. Great climb, true to its rating!
content.location: About 100' left of Wipeout behind a large fallen tree that had once been standing, hence the name of this route.

content.description: There is a square shaped slab in the center of the formation with 3 routes on it. Swim or Sink is the left route. It starts sort of in the center and traverses up and left to avoid the steeper section right off the ground. The other two routes here each have 4 bolts (and are the same length), while Swim or Sink only has 3. This gives it considerably more pucker factor, so get your slab head screwed on if you want to lead this. It can also be toproped by climbing Rock Lobster or Surfing first and then making a 4th class traverse over to the anchors.

There is a square shaped slab in the center of the formation with 3 routes on it. Surfing With the Wazoo is the one on the right. This is a relatively easy 10a and one of the most moderate climbs at the Beach.

Climb up an easy left facing flake/groove. Reach out left to clip the first bolt. Climb up the slab to a shallow dish, then up more slab finishing up the water-streak.

content.protection: 5 bolts, anchors at top (same ones as Low Tide), lower or rap off.
content.location: Just right of Low Tide and to the left of Late Takeoff.

content.description: There is a square shaped slab in the center of the formation with 3 routes on it. Rock Lobster is the middle route. I found it quite a bit harder than Surfing With the Wazoo, despite only being rated one letter grade higher. These two route also share the same anchors.

climbs.name: Mountaineers Route
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Steve Cox, Bob Bolton  9/2002

content.description: Next route right of Holy Handgrenade.  A difficult start leads to fun edging.  Make a few hard moves, get to a rest and repeat until you get to the anchor.  I've listed the guidebook rating but it didn't feel any harder than Holy Handgrenade which is rated 10b.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt rap anchor shared with Holy Handgrenade

content.description: On the very left side of The Beach, starts in a right facing flake.  Climb up the flake on some smears to clip the first bolt and then continue edging and smearing to the top.  Felt harder than 10a, similar in difficulty to Holy Handgrenade and Mountaineers route.  I would call it 10b/c.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a 2 bolt rap anchor
3 bolts, anchors at top, lower off or rap
content.location: Just right of White Shadow and left of Shallow Water

content.description: This is one of the easiest routes at the Beach. Lizard King is in the middle-ish of Left Wall. It's defining characteristic is a right-facing flake about 7 feet off the ground. The first clip is kind of high, but it's not that scary because this flake makes the last bit of climbing easy. After that it's slab climbing up to the anchors.

climbs.name: Late Takeoff
climbs.fa: Mike Waugh, Bob Bolton, Darrell Hensel (7/2007)

content.protection: 5 bolts, anchors at top (shared with Banana Hammock), lower or rap off.
content.location: Just right of Shallow Water and left of Banana Hammock.

content.description:
This is at the left end of the Left Wall. Look for a 10ft tall, right-facing, lieback flake. This flake is the start of Manta Ray (10a). The next bolt line to the right is Holy Handgrenade. It has a large pocket/hole about 6 feet up. Climb up the slab to an anchor shared with Mountaineers Route (10c, the next climb to the right)

I sort of like this one. The crimps are a little bit bigger and the rock is slightly steeper.

content.protection: 6 bolts, anchors at top (shared with Yummy Noises), lower off or rap.

climbs.name: Banana Hammock
climbs.fa: Troy Mayr, Bob Bolton, Steve Cox (10/2002)

content.protection: 6 bolts, anchors at top (shared with Late Takeoff), lower off or rap.
content.location: Just right of Late Takeoff. Further right is Yummy Noises.
